A chessboard can be used as a puzzle game by placing objects on the squares and challenging someone to find a way to move them all to a different square.
A chessboard can be used as a game board for a strategy game other than chess, such as Go or Stratego.
A chessboard can be used as a visual tool for planning out a project or task, with each square representing a different step or task.
A chessboard can be used as a decorative item, with colorful pieces and patterns adding a unique touch to a room.
A chessboard can be used as a way to teach problem-solving skills, with each square representing a different problem and the player having to find a solution.
